article.text: President Michel Sleiman received on Saturday Progressive Socialist Party leader MP Walid Jumblatt and reviewed with him a number of issues including the matter of the 13 Lebanese Shia Muslims who were kidnapped in Syria’s Aleppo earlier this week. The National News Agency said that Jumblatt agreed to attend future national dialogue sessions. However, the report did not elaborate any further. On Thursday, Sleiman voiced his support for a new session of national dialogue, saying that he called on all leaders to meet in the second week of June following a series of clashes linked to the Syrian uprising, which broke out in Tripoli and Beirut over the past two weeks.The report added that Sleiman had made a series of phone calls on Saturday related to the matter of the abducted Lebanese pilgrims. The president underlined the importance of resolving this matter and releasing the abductees. According to the NNA, 13 Lebanese Shia Muslims were kidnapped in Aleppo province on Tuesday as they were returning home by bus from a pilgrimage in Iran. Their families said that they were kidnapped by Syrian rebels. The Free Syrian Army, however, denied the accusation. The kidnapping took place amid heightened tension in Lebanon over the Syrian crisis.
